Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Jacob L
Reviews.Content: Oh my God !!!! The worst hotel experience we've ever had. The hotel is located on a busy road in Camberwell.There is no parking and we (myself and my wife) had to go to nearby residential streets to find a parking space.The walls and the decor are very dated and are in desperate need of a refurb.I didn't get the chance to visit all floors but our floor (1st Floor) was engulfed in cigarrette smell even though this is supposed to be a non-smoking hotel. The smell of cigarrettes was also intense in our room. Whenever we returned back to the hotel and opened our door, the cig smell just hits us. Sleep was ok but the sheets smelt of cigs and it was unbearable. The shower curtain....was just a disgrace and revolting. Breakfast was awful...no real breakfast just a bunch of cheap cerals,some fruits and bread. In short, i will NEVER come to this hotel again.Not even if it's the last place on earth.I would rather sleep in the open. Yuk !!!

Reviews.Title: “Far better than expected after reading reviews on here!”
Reviews.Author: psychpolly
Reviews.Content: Prior to our trip I read reviews on this site and was genuinely apprehensive upon arrival as to what I was about to discover. We are a young couple who stayed for 4 nights, choosing this hotel as it's in central London, cheap, included breakfast and has en-suite rooms. Although the room was tiny, it was adequate, and we weren't planning on spending long there. The bathroom, towels, bed linen and room in general were undeniably clean. The whole hotel is shabby and in need of attention but we felt safe and clean which was the main thing, especially after reading so many negative reviews. The tube station is quite a long walk away but the buses are regular. Breakfast was toast, cereal and fruit (hardly expected a slap-up full english from a budget hotel). Customer service is lacking but again we weren't there for luxury treatment. Keys must be left at reception when you go out which isn't ideal. Perhaps other reviewers were unfortunate, or we were just lucky but I am a believer that people only write a review if they've had a bad experience and believe this place deserved a more balanced review, and that is that it is a very basic budget hotel in the centre of London, avoid if you're expecting luxury, probably fine for a safe, clean base. Plus I personally am a fan of brushing my teeth whilst sat on the toilet ;-)

Reviews.Title: “AVOID! AVOID! AVOID!”
Reviews.Author: 186356lou
Reviews.Content: This dated hotel is located on a busy a road. The bedrooms and bathrooms were all in desperate need of refurbishment. Rooms were dirty and the bed linen smelt of B.O

Reviews.Title: “VILE”
Reviews.Author: Barbie999
Reviews.Content: If you like a basic & clean hotel, then AVOID this one. The 'delux' single room was very small, smelt of stale cigarettes & the tiny bathroom smelt of stale urine, it was at the front of the buliding, which was very noisy, earplugs required. Basically, it was so bad I couldn't sleep in it & had to share with a colleague, whose room was larger, but unfortunately the bed sheets had complimentry stains of dribble on. When requested the sheets to be changed, they just went in the room & re-made the dirty ones. Had to request clean sheets at 11.30pm & was told they had to make a phonecall to get a key for the linen cupboard, was finally presented with clean sheets, but had to make our own beds at midnight! It was honestly the worst hotel I have ever stayed in, I am all for basic & clean, but this hotel was just disgusting & dated. The corridors outside our room also smelt of cannabis. DO NOT STAY HERE!!! There are cheaper & cleaner travel lodges in the city. I'm sure The Bates Motel would have been a nicer place to stay....

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely bloody awful (and that's being kind)”
Reviews.Author: elliott74
Reviews.Content: Room was just bigger than a broom cupboard. Bathroom was absolutely filthy and did not even dare have a shower at the hotel. Complimentary stripe of snot down bathroom door. Sheets appeared clean but the bed and pillows were hard. Very hot and noisy at night. Would have cancelled when we arrived but we couldn't afford to lose the money (that had been taken two days before we arrived!!!!!) and pay for another hotel. Would only recommend this hotel to someone I really disliked.

Reviews.Title: “what a complete dump!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: p_ofdarkness67
Reviews.Content: carpets in corridor looked like they something from a bad care home. Floor had no carpet, just nasty wooden flooring that was all scrapped. cheap old portable telly like summat from the second hand shop. beds, well one was nearly on the floor it was that low and the other was high up. The shelf type thing between the beds that the phone was on was full of fag burns, and the room did have a stale odour of someone having smoked in there. Breakfast was crap so skipped on the rest of stay.This should not have a name of HOTEL, as B&B's have higher standards. Also did not like idea of having to leave the key if you went out, so would not advise leaving anything of value as it wouldnt be safe. Spent only sleeping time in there stayed out as late as possible in order to spend least time possible in the room. If a hotel is nice you dont mind going in it a bit more. On first getting there the impression I got of the room, made me even fear whether there was a possibility of it having bed bugs, but luckily not, so that was a blessing.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty poor but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: zoobus
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it is relatively close to the Brixton academy (30 minute walk). It's on a VERY noisy street. The room was tiny, smelled of paint, and was just ancient and cheap. It was Â£60 a night which is probably as cheap as you can get for a London hotel room. The breakfast was just toast or cereal. Bed was comfortable and sheets were clean though. Wouldn't recommend except as last resort.

Reviews.Title: “low price hotel”
Reviews.Author: StefanoF2
Reviews.Content: near Camberwell Green - well connected with Oval station - near ethnic restaurants and local shops.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly - clean - tidy - no probs”
Reviews.Author: lisa1978
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel as its website says a 10 min walk to the tube station. Don't be fooled it is more like a 20 min walk so i would advise you to get the bus 36 or 436 goes straight to it from oval tube station. the area can be quite intimidating and noisy with traffic the hotel itself does not look like much from the front but once you walk through the door its fine. I found both the lady and young gentleman on the front desk to be very friendly and pleasant. We were on the 3rd floor - no lift - and it is quite a lot of stairs to the 3rd floor but once in the room it had a very warm welcolming smell (air freshner but nice), the room had everything you would need, tv, window with view of london, shower etc. We were there for 2 nights and the towels were changed on the 2nd day which is unusual but nice. Breakfast was in the restaurant section and was the basic cereal, toast, juice but what more do you need for Â£60 a night i think this is a bargain! I would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awfull!!! Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: Enemydr
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay here on hostelworld.com . They charged us with booking fee and deposit. And guess what? YES, when we arrived at this magnificant hotel we had NO reservation, NO place to stay. So, another money, change of our departure dates from london with national express, etc. Very bad experience! I advise you to stay away from The New Dome hotel, as well as reservating online with hostelworld.com!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place in the world?”
Reviews.Author: rustystarfish
Reviews.Content: Well were do I start...from the moment I walked in I knew it was wrong. Basically The New Dome is an indian restaurant with rooms, its well in need of a renovation and a clean. The lady on reception wasnt too welcoming and we were directed to our rooms by her pointing at a door way. The rooms were small and dirty. The walls were in dia need of a repaint, the toilet looked like a public one in the middle of a park and the carpets looked like they had so much wild life in them I could ring David Attenborough. The sheets looked like they may not have been changed and I didnt feel alone in bed. This being the rooms I didnt arrive for breakfast . Am sorry but am not in the habit of writing bad reviews, I would rather just not write one if am not pleased, but people need to be aware of The New Dome, if your really desperate then go for it, but If I wasnt with my daughter I would have slept rough. Overall I would never set foot in here again.

Reviews.Title: “Discrace”
Reviews.Author: GiGaDaNcE_2
Reviews.Content: Terrible Service, Wouldnt give breakfast at 9:45am and said it was on till 10:00am, Rat Catcher in room, Discrace for a Â£70 per night hotel as there are Â£30 hotels which are miles better when down there. STAY AWAY FROM THIS ONE.

Reviews.Title: “Need new mattresses and bedding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Carpets, paintwork and fixtures all very worn and not too clean. My mattress consisted of a grid of one-inch diameter springs covered with what felt like a single sheet. Had to sleep on top of the duvet as the springs hurt too much - with only the bedspread for cover. The bedspread had SIX cigarette burns or possibly moth holes in it. Laundered and clean, but really 'not nice'. If it wasn't for the state of the mattress and bedspread it would be fine for the price, but it's just not.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service??? Whats that?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Would not use this hotel for my dogs. Upon arriving they had no record of a booking made over 4 weeks in advance and claimed no payment had been made. Would only acknowledge they had received payment on day 3 of our stay after I had phoned the credit card company. Had to spend 2 nights on a bed with a metal spring poking through the mattress then arrived back on night 3 to find the room had been flooded from above no attempt had been made to protect our belongings and our towels had been laid on the bed and floor to help soak some of the water up. We were then left to move all our things to another room one floor down, received no apology and were only provided with the standard one towel per person. No reduction was made for the cost of our stay following the inconvenience. The rooms donâ€™t smell to pleasant and bathrooms are not cleaned to much of a standard between guests, the carpets are extremely overdue replacement or at least a shampoo.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm, not so good”
Reviews.Author: admiral_eugene
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days for a course in Kings College. Lights didnt work in room, so was moved the next day. Breakfast was not so good (cornflake dust from bottom of box, very grumpy woman who provided coffee on 3/5 days).Room and bathroom just about clean. Position good for the college, but that was about it.Note no tube stations nearby. I kept out of the hotel apart from sleeping! It would do for a functional stay, as price OK, but i would not come here for pleasure-I were visting London I would stay elsewhere.

HotelInfo.Name: The New Dome Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 51-53 Camberwell Church St, London SE5 8TR, England
